posts.title: the best comment I ever seen about the European situation now
posts.content:
Americans always have a difficult time understanding the dysfunction within the "European" system and think the dysfunction is a symptom of the system malfunctioning. This couldn't be farther from the truth - this is explicitly how the system was designed.

The goal of the "European Experiment" was the destruction of the nation state and the creation of the European Super State by reducing/destroying the economic imbalance between the north of the EU and the south.

Because getting the Italians and Greeks to be as economically strong as Germany and the Netherlands is an impossibility, pragmatism kicked in and the goal is to bring down the north of Europe to the level of the weakest link.

For decades this was brought on by luxurious vacation allotments, generous maternity leave packages and accelerated post-euro with the Target2 intra-bank balancing system, the soft guarantee of PIIGS debt by Germany and the various "rescue" mechanisms that were instituted between 2008-2015 and never went away.

The system here is dying be design. What is unexpected however is the rise in "populism" and the desire of more and more people to not turn themselves into some amorphous blob of humanity but rather retain their national identities.

To fight this the system brought in guilt-based education and media. Every country has it and it is used against the people to prevent them from "electing" political parties seeking to stop the decay of their respective civilizations.

This worked for a time until the second Greek Euro crisis in 2012 at which point it became clear that there was a shift in the Overton Window back towards nationalism and away from globalism. It was at this time some group of (Jewish) Bureaucrats in Brussels decided that if Europe will not integrate voluntarily economically - they'll do it culturally and genetically.

Then the flood of Arabs, Pakis and Africans started. Suddenly the difference between a Frenchman and a German wasn't that large when compared to Muhammad from Islamabad and his cousins, Muhammad, Muhammad, Muhammad and Muhammad. There was a "European" version of a "rally around the flag" moment where even the dumbest of moderate voters could see there was a problem here.

The EU's plan might have worked had the far-left/greenies not taking up the "the poor black/brown people we have to help them" and kicked off their own "refugees welcome" populist revolt soon thereafter.

For the true believers on either side - many see the current system as fixable. For those of us (and those in Brussels and Frankfurt) that are brutal pragmatists - its generally accepted this system is a walking corpse that will collapse into itself as soon as its own forward-moving inertia stops.

For those of us who are conservative in nature, we want it to collapse as quickly as possible to stop the social, cultural and genetic damage to our civilization. For those on the "socially-progressive left" - they want this system to continue on as long as possible to make as much of their change irreversible at best and set the starting point far in their direction at the least.

God help us all
